page.title: 09KING'S NYMPTON ECOLOGY
page.content: Ecology An abundance of natural plant and animal life exists in the King's Nympton area.The hedgerows provide shelter for rabbits,hedgehogs, weasels field mice and birds e.g.dunnock, chaffinch, yellow hammer,gold finch. Wild flowers are in evidence during Spring and Summer,the most common being primrose, red campion, foxglove,honeysuckle.Along Spittle Lane ragged robin can be seen in June and July. The woods in this area are mainly deciduous of beech, oak, hazel, ash, and sycamore. The two streams, Catham Lake and Tongue Lake are unpolluted,and heron may be seen on the banks and at evening the wild Red Deer come to drink from the cool water. The removal of some hedges and mechanised hedge cutting has reduced the number of small reptiles.
